page.title: 05PUBLIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Except for the churches there are few public buildings in the square. There is a Field Study Centre at Freiston Hall where children can come to study the villages and the marshes. There are Post offices in each village which also serve as village stores and a butchers at Freiston. The Fishtoft Post Office was once the village blacksmithy. It has been rebuilt and is now a very big shop. There are several pubs, the Bull and Dog in Freiston having connections with the Priory, the Bull refering to the Papal Bull. On the Playing Field in Freiston is The Danny Flear Centre and at Fishtoft a Social Club. There is the Manor House Club in Fishtoft where the school has duck races and dances. Freiston and Butterwick have village halls, used for social functions.
